qas.question: What law was signed on Sep 14, 2001?

answers.text: Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Terrorists

qas.question: Who did the AUMF authorize the US military attacking?

answers.text: those responsible for the attacks on 11 September 2001

qas.question: What law did Congress refer to as a basic for the AUMF?

answers.text: section 5(b) of the War Powers Resolution

qas.question: When was the War Powers Resolution passed?

plausible_answers.text: The Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Terrorists

qas.question: What is UAMF also known as?

plausible_answers.text: The Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Terrorists

qas.question: What was made law on 11 September 2001?

plausible_answers.text: the use of United States Armed Forces against those responsible for the attacks on 11 September 2001.

qas.question: What does the AUMF authorize Congress?

plausible_answers.text: The Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Terrorists or "AUMF"

qas.question: What was made law on 11 September?
Which section of AUMF authorized armed forces to respond?
What month was the War Powers Resolution signed?
What previous resolution did AUMF contradict?

context: <b4_0><b5_0><b8_0>The <a0_0>Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Terrorists<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> or "AUMF"<b8_0/> was made law on 14 <b10_0>September<b10_0/> 2001, to authorize <b7_0>the use of United States Armed Forces against <a1_0>those responsible for the attacks on 11 September 2001<a1_0/>.<b7_0/> It authorized <b11_0>the President<b11_0/> to use all necessary and appropriate force against those nations, organizations, or persons he determines planned, authorized, committed, or aided the terrorist attacks that occurred on 11 September 2001, or harbored such organizations or persons, in order to prevent any future acts of international terrorism against the United States by such nations, organizations or persons. Congress declares this is intended to constitute specific statutory authorization within the meaning of <a2_0>section <b9_0>5(b)<b9_0/> of the <b6_0><b12_0>War Powers Resolution<b12_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> of <a3_0>1973<a3_0/>.
